meanings.definition: The qualities idealized by knighthood such as bravery, courtesy, honor, and gallantry.
meanings.sent1: His chivalrousness was evident in the way he always stood up for the weak.
meanings.sent2: The knight's chivalrousness shone through as he helped the elderly lady cross the street.
meanings.sent3: The chivalrousness of the squirrel offering a nut to the bird made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her chivalrousness was like a shining armor protecting those in need.
meanings.sent5: The chivalrousness of the firefighter rushing into the burning building was truly heroic.

meanings.definition: The act of being courteous and gallant, especially towards women.
meanings.sent1: His chivalrousness towards his grandmother was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated his chivalrousness when he held the door open for her.
meanings.sent3: The chivalrousness of the cat bringing a mouse as a gift to its owner was amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her chivalrousness towards strangers was like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The chivalrousness of the young boy offering his seat to the elderly lady was touching.

meanings.definition: The practice of upholding the values of chivalry.
meanings.sent1: In the medieval times, chivalrousness was a code that knights followed.
meanings.sent2: She admired his chivalrousness in always treating others with respect.
meanings.sent3: The chivalrousness of the penguin offering a pebble to its mate was endearing.
meanings.sent4: His chivalrousness in defending his beliefs was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The chivalrousness of the student helping a classmate with their work was commendable.
